get.summary: List of applications associated with user's account
get.description:
List all the Internal and Thirdy-Party apps associated with user's account. 

* Internal apps: are the apps already existent in the admin console
* Thirdy-party apps: external apps which users granted permissions like Facebook, GitHub and etc.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: Client ID to set a consent for

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Allows to filter just single credential type, which will be specified as this parameter. If null, it will return all credential types

parameters.name: userCredentials
parameters.description: Specifies if user credentials should be returned. If true, they will be returned in the "userCredentials" attribute of particular credential. Defaults to true.

200.description:
Retrieve the stream of credentials available to the current logged in user.
It will return only credentials of enabled types,  which user can use to au
thenticate in some authentication flow.

401.description: Expired token, or the client role `view-profile` is not assigned

get.description: Retrieve the account information associated with the authenticated user.

400.description:
HTTP response on invalid requests. For example:

* Trying to modify the `username`, which is read-only, trough the API.
* Using a malformed HTTP request

401.description:
Access token does not have the rights to create or modify an account. Potential causes:

* Expired access token
* Access token does not have access to perform this operation
